net.tinyos.prowler

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.tinyos.prowler.Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Mica2Node

    public abstract class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the base class of all nodes. Nodes are entities in a simulator which act on behalf of themselves, they also have some basic attributes like location. Nodes also take part in radio transmissions, they initiate transmissions and receive incomming radio messages.
    Author:
    Gabor Pap, Gyorgy Balogh, Miklos Maroti

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Node nextNode
      Nodes of the Simulator are linked together in a single linked list.
      Simulator simulator
      A reference to the simulator in which the Node exists.

    • Field Detail

      • nextNode

        public Node nextNode
        Nodes of the Simulator are linked together in a single linked list. This points to the next element.

        A reference to the simulator in which the Node exists.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Node

        public Node(Simulator sim,
    RadioModel radioModel)
        Parameterized constructor, sets the simulator and creates an initial neighborhood using the RadioModel as a factory.
        Parameters:
        sim - the Simulator
        radioModel - the RadioModel used to create the nodes neighborhood

    • Method Detail

      • getNeighborhood

        public net.tinyos.prowler.RadioModel.Neighborhood getNeighborhood()
        A getter method used by the RadioModels to manipulate neighborhood of nodes.

      • getDistanceSquare

        public double getDistanceSquare(Node other)
        Calculates the square of the distance between two nodes. This method is used by the radio models to calculate the fading of radio signals.
        Parameters:
        other - The other node
        Returns:
        The square of the distance between this and the other node

      • getMaximumRadioStrength

        public double getMaximumRadioStrength()
        Returns the maximum radio strength this node will ever transmit with. This must be a positive number.
        Returns:
        the maximum transmit radio power
        See Also:
        beginTransmission(double, java.lang.Object)

      • setMaximumRadioStrength

        public void setMaximumRadioStrength(double d)
        A setter function for the maxRadioStrength field.
        Parameters:
        d - the desired new transmit strength of this mote

      • sendMessage

        public abstract boolean sendMessage(java.lang.Object message,
                  Application app)
        Sends out a radio message. If the node is in receiving mode the sending is postponed until the receive is finished. This method should behave exactly as the SendMsg.send command in TinyOS.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be sent
        app - the application sending the message
        Returns:
        If the node is in sending state it returns false otherwise true.

      • setId

        public void setId(int id)
        Sets the id of the node. It is allowed that two nodes have the same id for experimentation.
        Parameters:
        id - the new id of the node.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(double x,
               double y,
               double z)
        Sets the position of the mote in space. Please call the RadioModel.updateNeighborhoods() to update the network topology information before starting the simulation.
        Parameters:
        x - the x position
        y - the y position
        z - the z position

      • getX

        public double getX()
        A getter function for position X.
        Returns:
        Returns the x coordinate of the node.

        A getter function for position Y.
        Returns:

      • getId

        public int getId()

      • getSimulator

        public Simulator getSimulator()
        Returns:
        simply returns the simulator in which this Node exists

      • addApplication

        public void addApplication(Application app)
        This function is part of the application management. Adds an Application to the list of applications running on this Node. Note that applications on a node represent TinyOS components, so do not try to solve all your problems in a derived class of Node. Also note that there can be only one instance of an Application class running on every Node, unlike components in TinyOS! Yes, this is a reasonable constraint that makes message demultiplexing easier.
        Parameters:
        app - the Application

      • getApplication

        public Application getApplication(java.lang.Class appClass)
        Visiting the elements of the application list, it returns the first with the given application class.
        Parameters:
        appClass - the class that identifies the needed application for us
        Returns:
        Returns the application instance running on this node

      • removeApplication

        public void removeApplication(java.lang.Class appClass)
        Visiting the elements of the application list, it removes the first with the given application class.
        Parameters:
        appClass - the class that identifies the needed application for us

      • display

        public void display(Display disp)
        The default implementation of the display function, calls the display funtions of the member applications.
        Parameters:
        disp - the main display provided by the Simulator
